column1: #Text=Bang bang ' : UK mercenary charged with murdering colleagues gives evidence in Iraq
#Text=Danny Fitzsimons , 30 , gave evidence today to the court in Karkh , Baghdad trying him for murdering a fellow Brit and an Australian in August 2009 .
#Text=The security contractor said his ArmorGroup collegues had tried to kill him in the city 's Green Zone , challenged the fairness of his trial and offered a plea bargain .
#Text=Fitzsimons used his pistol to kill Darren Hoare , 37 , from Queensland , Australia and Paul McGuigan , 37 , from Peebles , Borders , Scotland .
#Text=The first Westerner tried in Iraq since the invasion in 2003 , he testified that the trio were drinking whisky and began fighting after he punched McGuigan 's face .
#Text=He claimed McGuigan had him at gunpoint with an M4 rifle while Hoare pushed him on the ground after the pair entered his room .
#Text=" I was seconds away from my death so I pulled my pistol , " Fitzsimons told the three-judge panel .
#Text=" I shouted twice to put down the weapon .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Next , according to Fitzsimons , he fired a third shot , this time hitting McGuigan in the face .

#Text=His widow has described the three shots as an  execution " .

column1: #Text=In further testimony today Fitzsimons told the judges Hoare then grabbed the pistol and tried to force it " to my throat to kill me ... and while we were wrestling I fired two shots in the chest .

column3:

#Text=Fitzsimons retorted that he believes this breaches his right to a fair trial :

_	_	_	_

#Text=The right to a fair trial is enshrined in Article 10 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights , which states  [ e]veryone is entitled ... to a fair and public hearing by an independent and impartial tribunal , in the determination of ... any criminal charge against him .

#Text= The Constitution of Iraq states in Article 19 " [ t]he accused is innocent until proven guilty in a fair legal trial , " and " [ e]very person shall have the right to be treated with justice in judicial ... proceedings .
